==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|おう|ぎ|yomi=o}}
{{IPAchar|/augi/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɔːgi/}} → {{IPAchar|/oːgi/}}

Possibly coined in Japan of {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived elements, as a Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=おうぎ|奥|tr1=ō|t1=inner, inside|義|tr2=gi|t2=meaning, significance}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|おうぎ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おうぎ|あうぎ}}

# the [[heart]] or [[depth]] of something; the [[inner]] [[secret]]s of something

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|奥義書|おうぎしょ}}: an [[esoteric]] [[book]]
* {{ja-r|奥義抄|おうぎしょう}}: a three-volume [[compendium]] of {{m|ja|和歌|tr=waka}} [[criticism]], published in the late {{w|Heian period}}
{{der-bottom}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|極意|ごくい}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|おく|ぎ|yomi=y}}
Alternative reading of ''ōgi'' above, using the [[訓読み#Japanese|kun'yomi]] pronunciation of ''oku'' for the {{m|ja|奥}} character.  This ''oku'' reading is more common when {{m|ja|奥}} is used on its own.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=y|おくぎ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{l|ja|奥儀}} {{qualifier|appears to be specific to the ''okugi'' reading}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おくぎ}}

# the [[heart]] or [[depth]] of something; the [[inner]] [[secret]]s of something

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|極意|ごくい}}
